intro: Quercus ungeri, commonly known as the Unger oak, is a species of deciduous tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its lobed leaves, which are typically dark green on top and lighter in color underneath. It produces small, spiny acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus ungeri is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
